definition: to fuddle/to befuddle/to inebriate/to get someone drunk

sentences.english: Get a fish drunk in Ohio.
sentences.chinese: 在俄亥俄州，不可以把鱼灌醉。

sentences.english: Last night we drank him under the table.
sentences.chinese: 昨天晚上我们把他灌醉了。

sentences.english: It's not kind to get young girls drunk.
sentences.chinese: 把年轻姑娘灌醉是缺德的事。

sentences.english: Do you want to drink Peter under the table? Well...you would never do.
The depression comes cannot from already when, I am met oneself burst into tears after fuddle .
sentences.chinese: 压抑至无法自已的时候，我会把自己灌醉后放声大哭。

sentences.english: He was liquored up by his colleagues.
HEROD: It may be he is drunk with the wine of God.
sentences.chinese: 他肯能是被上帝的酒灌醉了。

sentences.english: He claims he's a big drinker, but even his daughter could drink him under the table.
sentences.chinese: 他自称是个酒仙，可是甚至连他的女儿都能把他灌醉。

sentences.english: In fact, three bottles of beer drunk how can you do, where are you muttered whispers.
sentences.chinese: 其实三瓶啤酒怎么能把你灌醉呢，你在那里喃喃细语。
咱们也不能灌醉15岁的女孩。

definition: to force sb to drink alcohol
dead drunk/as drunk as a lord
to knock sb out with a drug/to render sb unconscious
lit. as drunk as mud/completely drunk
to send sb away (with an excuse)
to prescribe medicine/to poison/to slip a drug (into sb's drink etc)
to get thoroughly drunk (idiom)/to get plastered
to force oneself upon sb (idiom)/to rape
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
to get drunk and act crazy/roaring drunk
